channel.title: Need help urgent
channel.description:
Hello guys i am Purple and i am here today with an issue. If you can help me contact me via skype - colour.scape
I have tried portforwading my server several times and none of the times does it succesfully work..
I have followed many guides via youtube and gaming forums but it dont work. Here is what it looks like after being portforwarded. [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/ozw6j62.png[/img]
Please i need help! When i visit websites to check if the port is online it just says connection timed out! on 43594... [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/1twQRfa.png[/img]
Please help me!

item.title: Need help urgent
item.dc:creator: @purple123ftw purple123ftw
item.description:
@purple123ftw wrote:

xx matty xx:

I think you’ve just defined the portforwarding rule but still need to assign it to your server?

As i said im a noob to all this, is there any chance you could add my skype and help me via that if so colour.scape, ir if you want me too add you just leave your skype here or message it too me.

BUMP please just need a little help!

Read full topic

item.title: Need help urgent
item.dc:creator: @purple123ftw purple123ftw
item.description:
@purple123ftw wrote:

so whenever i try and portforward i get this:

However when i’ve been watching tutorials they always seem to have the number below the “#” as 1, where as mine always stays at 0.

i am really confused as to why it does this… please can someone help

Read full topic

item.title: Need help urgent
item.dc:creator: @Coldmedicine Coldmedicine
item.description:
@Coldmedicine wrote:

Firewall - Off, Antivirus - Off.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help urgent
item.dc:creator: @purple123ftw purple123ftw
item.description:
@purple123ftw wrote:

[quote=“4x4Chevrolet, post:10, topic:529131”]http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/routerindex.htm

Consult the link above, find your router and follow that exactly, you could be under a different section, mistakenly.

Make sure firewall exceptions are added for the ports, and that the server is running when you consult canyouseeme.org

If it isn’t, it won’t work. If all else fails, be connected to your gateway, have the portforward.com link open under your router, and send me your TV info, and I’ll take a look at it.[/quote]

Will it be okay if i message you in the morning as where i am now its 01:42am and i don’t want to mess up my sleeping schedule :S

Read full topic

item.title: Need help urgent
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/routerindex.htm

Consult the link above, find your router and follow that exactly, you could be under a different section, mistakenly.

Make sure firewall exceptions are added for the ports, and that the server is running when you consult canyouseeme.org

If it isn’t, it won’t work. If all else fails, be connected to your gateway, have the portforward.com link open under your router, and send me your TV info, and I’ll take a look at it.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help urgent
item.dc:creator: @purple123ftw purple123ftw
item.description:
@purple123ftw wrote:

4x4Chevrolet:

When you ‘port-forward’ you’re telling your router to direct connections on specific ports to a certain machine on the network. Each machine connected to the network has it’s own IPv4 address, and if supported, it’s own IPv6 address, you must make sure that the IP you’re telling the router to send the connections to is the IPv4 of your PC. 192.168.1.1 and 192.168.1.2 are common gateway addresses, so make sure that you haven’t put that in for the IP, thinking that’s what you’re supposed to do. Go back to CMD, /ipconfig, get your IPv4, and put that in the spot.

Umm this is the only things i can do

Read full topic

item.title: Need help urgent
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

When you ‘port-forward’ you’re telling your router to direct connections on specific ports to a certain machine on the network. Each machine connected to the network has it’s own IPv4 address, and if supported, it’s own IPv6 address, you must make sure that the IP you’re telling the router to send the connections to is the IPv4 of your PC. 192.168.1.1 and 192.168.1.2 are common gateway addresses, so make sure that you haven’t put that in for the IP, thinking that’s what you’re supposed to do. Go back to CMD, /ipconfig, get your IPv4, and put that in the spot.

Read full topic
